title: Implement Unicode character classification for Haskell identifiers
body:
Implement Unicode character classification per Haskell 2010 Report section 2.2.

**Deliverables:**
- Functions to classify Unicode code points per Haskell 2010 rules:
  - `isUniSymbol(c)` — Unicode symbol/punctuation (for operators)
  - `isUniLetter(c)` — Unicode letter (for identifiers)
  - `isUniDigit(c)` — Unicode digit
  - `isUniWhitespace(c)` — Unicode whitespace
- Handle the distinction between `small` (lowercase start) and `large` (uppercase start) identifiers
- Unit tests with representative Unicode characters (Greek, Cyrillic, CJK, mathematical symbols)

**Design notes:**
- Zig's `std.unicode` provides some classification but may not cover all Haskell-specific categories
- Consider using a C library (ICU, utf8proc) via Zig's C interop per project mantra #2
- Haskell 2010 Report section 2.2 defines the exact Unicode categories for each lexical class
